abstract: Hard-liners in Iran are keeping unusually low profile as country's negotiators prepare to restart nuclear talks with United States; silence of hard-line Shiite Muslim clerics and commanders of Revolutionary Guards is due to wish on part of supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei for solution from negotiations, and reflects general satisfaction with direction of talks and success country has been enjoying in region.
lead_paragraph: Iran’s usually vocal clerics and military commanders are heeding the call of the country’s supreme leader, who has largely supported the negotiations.

headline.main: Iran’s Hard-Liners Show Restraint on Nuclear Talks With U.S.
headline.print_headline: Iran Hard-Liners Show Restraint on Nuclear Deal

snippet: Iran’s usually vocal clerics and military commanders are heeding the call of the country’s supreme leader, who has largely supported the negotiations.
